text: <extra_id_0> CholecystokininB receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> from human Jurkat lymphoblastic T cells is involved in activator protein - 1-responsive gene activation .
The aim of this study was to analyze the role of cholecystokinin <extra_id_0> (CCK(B)) receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human lymphoblastic Jurkat T cells .
We investigated the trophic effect resulting from activation of such a receptor by using the reporter gene strategy .

For this purpose , we transiently transfected Jurkat T cells with the reporter plasmid p [ ( TRE ) 3-tk-Luc ] and found that CCK-8 was able to dose-dependently induce <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression related to activator protein - 1 ( AP-1 ) activation with a maximal response identical to that obtained with compounds known to activate AP-1 complex ( quantitatively , the same level of induction was obtained with 1 nM 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate , 100 microM diacylglycerol , or 4 nM epidermal growth factor ) .

text: The involvement of the <extra_id_0> CCK(B) receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in such a stimulation was demonstrated by the inhibiting effect of the selective <extra_id_0> CCK(B) receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antagonist PD-135 , 158 .
This effect was confirmed in COS-7 cells transfected with the cDNA of <extra_id_0> CCK(B) receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cloned from Jurkat T cells .

To better understand the AP-1 - dependent <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in Jurkat T cells , we tested two specific inhibitors of <extra_id_0> serine/threonine phosphatases-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> -2A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> : okadaic acid and calyculin A .

text: These compounds strongly increased the phorbol-12-myristate-13-acetate response , whereas we have not observed a contribution of phosphatase inhibitors on a CCK-8 - induced <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity .

To confirm that <extra_id_0> CCK(B) receptors <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are involved in AP-1 response , we investigated the CCK-8 effect on <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression , a natural endogenous gene regulated by several factors , including AP-1 .

text: This induction was abolished by PD-135 , 158 .

Our results indicate that CCK-8 exerts a trophic effect in Jurkat T cells through stimulation of <extra_id_0> CCK(B) receptors <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by modulation of expression of AP-1 - regulated genes .
